Description: Define another scenario ID from which the current scenario should inherit the defined values
Path (relative or absolute) to the input data
Path (relative or absolute) to the directory where the output should be saved
Name of the database that contains the system structure
Start date in the format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS - if the data start after start date, simulation will wait for the data to start
End date in the format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS - if the data end earlier, simulation will stop there
Number of time steps per hour
Path (relative or absolute) to the EV driving profiles and other EV related data
Use the emission time series for electricity demand from the grid (if it is available in the data) if set to true (default)
Use the electricity prices time series (if it is available in the data) if set to true (default)
Additional open space PV power in kWp
Additional open space wind power in kWp
ID of the scenario which defines the expansion

Config Parameter Name: expansion PV min kWp for section usage
Description: Minimal size of a PV installation on a roof section, to include this section

Config Parameter Name: expansion PV max inst kWp per section
Description: Maximal size of a PV installation in kW per roof section

Config Parameter Name: expansion PV max inst kWp per unit
Description: Maximal size of the total PV installation in kW per control unit

Config Parameter Name: expansion PV kWp per roof area in m2
Description: kWp per roof area (how it is in the three dimensional space)

Required: only if ‘expansion PV kWp static mode’ is set to true
Description: see next variable
If set to true, ignore all roof information and just add a static pv installation per roof

Config Parameter Name: expansion PV static mode profile orientation
Description: Profile orientation if static mode is selected

Config Parameter Name: expansion PV static mode profile index
Description: Profile index if static mode is selected. Especially usefull if an fixed orientation is given

Config Parameter Name: expansion PV max total kWp addition
Description: Maximal size of all added PV installations over all control units
Power in kW of the simulatively added batteries
Capacity in kWh of the simulatively added batteries
Initial SOC of the simulatively added batteries

Required: only if ‘expansion BS power computation mode’ == ‘Use E:P ratio’
Description: E:P-ratio for setting the power of simulatively added batteries dependent of the capacity (interesting for parameter variations)
If set to ‘Use E:P ratio’ the variabel ‘expansion BS P in kW’ will be ignored, instead P will be E / this variable

Possible Values: ‘const’, ‘use PV power’ or ‘use mean annual consumption’
Description: Defines the rule for the calculation of the battery capacity. If set to ‘const’, the value of ‘expansion BS E in kWh’ will be used. If set to ‘use PV power’, the capacity of the added storage is the kWp of the PV installation multiplied with the parameter ‘use PV power’ if a simulated PV installation is present. Else it uses the same parameter as ‘const’. If set to ‘use mean annual consumption’, it uses the mean annual consumption of the measurement units as defined in the data given.
Maxium capacity of an added battery storage (very important for sizing with other modes than constant, but always applied). Defaults to -1.0, meaning there is no limit set.

Config Parameter Name: expansion BS capacity sizing factor for PV
Description: The sizing parameter of the battery storage if the computation mode is ‘use PV power’
Efficiency of the battery for charging in percent
Efficiency of the battery for discharging in percent
Self-discharging rate in percent per time step
Power consumption of the battery controller if SOC is 0 in kW
Power consumption of the battery controller if SOC is 1 in kW

Config Parameter Name: expansion BS max total E addition
Description: Upper limit for the capacity of all added resid. battery storage systems
The probability of plugin in an EV when arraving at home (special cases for low SOC are hard coded)
The demand per kWh energy taken from the grid - This parameter is ignored if a time series on the demand prices is given
The emissions in CO2eq per kWh of energy taken from the grid - This parameter is ignored if a time series on emissions is given

Config Parameter Name: net present value time horizon in years

Description: Controls how the profiles (if there are more than one) should be assigned to a new created component

Config Parameter Name: CU selection mode for comp. add.
Possible Values: as in data / random / best SSR / best NPV
Description: Controls how to select the control units for expansion, in case of best SSR and best NPV a simulation is executed first, where all SSR and NPV values for every control unit are computed, then they are sorted and finally this sorted list is taken

Config Parameter Name: select buildings with given heat demand only
Description: Select only buildings where the heat demand is given in the input database, table ‘heat_demand_per_location’

Config Parameter Name: annual heat demand limit for selection
Possible Values: -1 (for no limit) or a value between 1 and inf.
Description: Select only buildings where the heat demand is lower or equal than the given limit,  set to -1 (default) if no limit should be choosen
Defines the control strategy used inside the control units: rule-based control to optimize (using a linear program) PV self-consumption or an optimization with a perfect forecast
If a optimization is used a control strategy, if defines the number of time steps that the optimization looks into the future (i.e., the horizon)

If a optimization is used a control strategy, if defines after how many time steps the optimization is executed again inside the control units (the default value of 1 means, that the optimization is executed every time step)

Config Parameter Name: th. E to HP el. E conversion factor
Description: Factor for converting a thermal energy per building into a heat pump electricity consumption
Parameter for estimating the heat pump consumption if no data is given for a building in the data (param: coef. of the linear regression)
Parameter for estimating the heat pump consumption if no data is given for a building in the data (param: intercept of the linear regression)
